triples.name: Separation Logic
triples.relevance: The paper is built on separation logic as the foundational framework for verifying memory-manipulating programs.

triples.name: Thunk
triples.relevance: A thunk is the core data structure being analyzed, serving as a mutable store for computations and their results.

triples.name: Memoization
triples.relevance: Memoization is the service provided by thunks, storing computation results to avoid redundant recalculation.

triples.name: Amortized Analysis
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes time complexity using Okasaki's amortized analysis approach with time credits.

triples.name: Queue
triples.relevance: Multiple queue data structures (banker's, physicist's, implicit) are verified as examples in the paper.

triples.name: Stream
triples.relevance: Stream operations are verified as one of the applications of the proposed reasoning rules.

triples.name: Formal Verification
triples.relevance: The paper proposes machine-checked verification rules for amortized analysis with time credits in separation logic.
